episodes.title: California's undocumented workers help grow the economy — but there's a cost
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: California has the largest economy in the US. It's also the state with the most immigrants. These two facts are not unrelated, but the way immigrants build that economy is complex.

episodes.title: Trump warns of trade deficits. Economists say, who cares?
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: Speaking to Congress, President Trump highlighted that the US trade deficit is nearly $800 billion. Sounds scary. But does it matter?

episodes.title: South Korea's obsession with fried chicken, explained
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: It's so popular that tens of thousands of fried chicken restaurants have sprung up around the country in the last 20 years. And the competition is fierce.

episodes.title: Mexican officials aren’t so worried about Trump's vows to bring jobs back to the US
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: They are irritated, however. “It was annoying to wake up in the morning and see that before he went to take his morning piss, he already had written a Twitter against Mexico,” says one state secretary of economic development and labor. “What’s the fixation?”

episodes.title: A group of GOP elder statesmen is pushing a conservative plan to address climate change
episodes.author: Living on Earth
episodes.summary: Conservatives say they could support a carbon tax if it also reduced EPA regulations and made payments to consumers to offset the costs. A new plan tries to give them what they want.

episodes.title: Mexico rejects 'unilateral' US migration moves
episodes.author: Agence France-Presse
episodes.summary: Mexico vowed not to let the United States impose migration reforms on it as its leaders prepared Thursday to host US officials who are cracking down on illegal immigrants.

episodes.title: How communities react to immigration restrictions? 'People are buying tickets back home.'
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: The Department of Homeland Security this week announced the Trump administration's immigration plan, which includes increasing deportations.

episodes.title: Meet the millionaire teaching Syrian refugees how to be Canadian, his way
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: Do you have to be a vegetarian non-smoker to be successful as a Syrian refugee in Canada? Jim Estill says yes.

episodes.title: 'Day Without Immigrants' shutters restaurants and businesses across the country
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: How to measure the impact of a one-day event that highlights the role of immigrant labor?

episodes.title: Trump wants to renegotiate NAFTA. So what does that really mean?
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: President Donald Trump is expected to call for the renegotiation of NAFTA, which has governed the rules of trade between the US, Canada and Mexico since 1994. But what would a new deal look like?

episodes.title: Thousands of Mexicans protest Donald Trump and his wall
episodes.author: Agence France-Presse
episodes.summary: In what looked set to be Mexico's biggest anti-Trump protest yet, some 20 cities joined the call to march made by a group of dozens of universities, business associations and civic organizations.

episodes.title: One US tech company is using its brand to speak out against Trump's ban — in Arabic
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: One tech CEO is making a statement against the travel ban with a billboard in Times Square.

episodes.title: Rio’s water cleanup barely works and it’s crimping impoverished fishermen
episodes.author: GlobalPost
episodes.summary: In the run-up to the 2016 Summer Olympics, Rio’s state government came under fire for the disgusting state of the bay on which Olympic sailors would compete.

episodes.title: What happened to all the South American Trump Tower plans?
episodes.author: GlobalPost
episodes.summary: After Eric Trump reportedly ran up the taxpayer bill on a trip to Uruguay, we look at a few properties in South America that were supposed to carry the Trump name. Some still haven't gotten off the grand, and at least one was ditched by the president's company.

episodes.title: In a victory for the oil industry, Congress makes it easier to pay bribes for drilling rights
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: Oil and mining industries stand to gain as the US backs out of a rule to prevent overseas oil bribery.

episodes.title: The US tried extra-high tariffs before, in 1930. It was a disaster.
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: Trump's talk of massive tariffs has economists alarmed.

episodes.title: Almost half of what we do at work could be automated by 2055
episodes.author: Science Friday
episodes.summary: But in reality, researchers say automation could come much sooner — or later. One of the report’s authors dives in to the factors in play.

episodes.title: Donald Trump and Britain’s Theresa May talk up ‘most special relationship’ in their debut official visit
episodes.author: Agence France-Presse
episodes.summary: After some awkward preparations — the White House misspelled Theresa May’s name a few times — the two leaders survived their first big diplomatic moment together.

episodes.title: Unsure of the future, Mexican immigrants scramble to send money back home
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: Throughout his campaign, President Donald Trump made big promises about cracking down on immigrants, and building a wall between the US and Mexico. As he prepares to announce his plans, many are sending as much money as they can back home.

episodes.title: Companies remind Trump: What’s good for the planet can be good for business
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: As governments across the planet are aligning behind fighting climate change, more than 700 companies are urging President Donald Trump to keep the US heading along the same path.
